medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasingly restricted movement of limbs, feeding problems, and gastroenteritis (diarrhoea).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At 1 month old, the patient developed restricted movement of limbs. From 2.5 months, he began crying when moved and exhibited feeding issues and diarrhoea. By 4 months, he presented with hypoactivity, hypotonia, and sensitivity to passive movement. At 6 months, he developed flexion contractures in multiple joints, swollen joints, and body pain. Symptoms progressed to hyperpigmentation over bony prominences and recurrent respiratory infections. At 8 months, he exhibited failure to thrive with a weight of 7.0 kg (<2 SD), difficulty in head raising and sitting, along with gingival hypertrophy. By 2 years, he experienced recurrent acute bronchitis or pneumonia and persistent diarrhoea. At 3 years, he had an episode of severe diarrhoea leading to severe dehydration, seizure, and coma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient's mother was threatened with preterm labour at 3 months of gestation. Decreased foetal movement and foetal hydronephrosis were observed during pregnancy. The patient has no known family history of inherited syndromes.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's healthy older brother is 5 years old, and the mother had two induced abortions. No family history of similar symptoms or conditions is specified.
